events.description: Abigail Adams and Old Bess in person. Free Admission!

events.description: Engaging stories for children ages 5-12. Free Admission!

events.title: New Voices I
events.description: Hear some fresh new storytellers with some great tales to tell. Emcee - Linda Goodman. Free Admission!

events.title: 'My Tale' Competition
events.description: Emcee - Cora Newcomb. Open competition for Amateurs. Both Youth and Adults will compete for prizes. Winners present at the Grand Finale. Sign up. 7 minute limit. Free Admission!

events.title: New Voices II
events.description: Emcee - Linda Goodman. Round two of fresh new storytellers with some great tales to tell. Free Admission!

events.title: Liar's Contest
events.description: Emcee - Rodger Ellingwood. Yes, a new champion liar will be crowned. Winner presents at the Grand Finale. You don't want to miss this. $5 entry fee. Free Admission!

events.title: Carolina New Voices
events.description: Emcee - Suzette Hawkins, President SCSN. Come hear fresh new voices from South Carolina. Free Admission!

events.title: 'Tell It All' Grand Finale
events.description: The Grand Daddy of Storytelling at the Stone Soup Festival. All the featured storytellers will be strutting their stuff. Winners of 'Biggest Liar' and 'My Tales' competitions will also be presenting. Snacks available. $8/person or $20/family (2 adults and children under 16).
storytellers: Winners of 'Biggest Liar' and 'My Tale' Competitions

events.title: TWS - After Party
events.description: Time to kick back and enjoy the great spirit of storytelling by swapping tales with new friends over refreshments.

events.title: Stories of Grace
events.description: Worship with a 20-30 minute story sharing time by Tim Tingle. All faiths are welcome. Free Admission!

tellers.name: Sheila Arnold Jones
tellers.bio: Master Storyteller Sheila Arnold Jones has been gifted by God with performance skills and has been using this talent since she was eight years old. She became a full-time Story-teller in 2003 sharing “whatever story fits good in her mouth”. She also travels throughout the country providing Historic Character Presentations, Christian Monologues and Professional Development for Educators to schools and organizations. Sheila is often interactive and many times intersperses stories with song. She has participated in Storytelling Festivals in Virginia, Nebraska, North Carolina, Ohio, and was a New Voice Featured Teller at National Story-telling Festival, Jonesborough, TN in October 2015.
events: Fri - Ghost Stories a la Stone Soup

tellers.name: Tim Tingle
tellers.bio: Tim Tingle is an enrolled member of the Choctaw Nation of Oklahoma and a frequent speaker at tribal events. His great-great grandfather, John Carnes, walked the Trail of Tears in 1835, and memories of this family epic fuel his writing and telling. Author of thirteen books, from children’s illustrated to Young Adult, Tingle has performed at the Kennedy Center in Washington, D.C. Accompanying himself with flute and drum, he is a frequent presenter at the National Mu-seum of the American Indian and appears often at the National Storytelling Festi-val.
events: Fri - Ghost Stories a la Stone Soup

tellers.name: Faye Fulton
tellers.bio: Faye has been a professional speaker, communications trainer, and storyteller for almost two decades. She is a long-standing member of the National Speakers Associa-tion and she has conducted workshops in all 50 states. She grew up in Sicily and Trinidad and has traveled all over the world. Her travels and experiences with differ-ent cultures are reflected in her stories. She tells sto-ries in educational and corporate settings about her ad-ventures and the diverse group of people she has met over the years – from Sicilian Countesses to Trinidadian Chauffeurs. She also makes history come alive when she repre-sents the historic figure of Abigail Adams (wife of the second President of the United States – John Adams).

tellers.name: Martha Reed Johnson
tellers.bio: Martha is a 2014 World Storytelling Award Recipient for stories featured on her dubut CD, “Skinny Dipping & Other Life Lessons”. She has performed on stages from South Carolina to Maine and is co-host of the monthly “Story Swap” at the Clay Pot Coffee Shop in Florence, SC. Martha creates amazing stories from the ordinary and the not so ordinary moments in life. Her stories will tickle your funny bone and warm your heart. Martha is a member of the South Carolina Sto-rytelling Network and the National Storytelling Net-work.

tellers.name: Madeline Pots
tellers.bio: “My greatest joy is connecting with people through story-telling.” … a simple statement that sums up Madeline’s passion for her work. She has been a featured teller at many of Florida’s festivals including The Florida Storytel-ling Festival, Gamble Rogers Folk Festival and The Cracker Festival. She has performed at the Lowndes Shakespeare Center, The Orlando Museum of Art, Sci-ence Center, History Center and numerous schools and libraries. Madeline was born in Brooklyn, New York. She attended Boston University, New England Conservatory and Dalcroze School of Music. She moved to Florida in 1972 and has been involved in art, music and storytelling ever since.
events: Fri - Ghost Stories a la Stone Soup

tellers.name: Robin Schulte
tellers.bio: Today she travels around Florida performing interactive, theatrical storytelling shows both solo and as half of the tandem team Tales Two Tell. Her repertoire is a lively mix of folktales, literary adaptations and personal sto-ries. Her storytelling is authentic, artfully performed and laced with humor. In October 2014, she won the Story Slam at the National Storytelling Festival. She has been a featured performer at the renowned Florida Storytelling Festival and will perform at the NSN Fringe in Kansas City in July 2015. Her first CD of personal stories is entitled Jack and the Levitator and Other Sto-ries.
events: Fri - Ghost Stories a la Stone Soup
